title: Eye black penalty: Cam Heyward gives up controversial decoration
text:
Eye black penalty: Cam Heyward gives up controversial decoration Associated Press Posted: 10/21/2015 09:45:30 AM PDT Updated: 10/21/2015 09:46:52 AM PDT PITTSBURGH (AP) -- Cam Heyward is done fighting with the NFL over writing his father's nickname on his eye black. 
The Pittsburgh Steelers defensive end released a statement late Tuesday that he met with NFL officials after the league fined him for writing "Iron Head" on his eye black in consecutive weeks. Craig "Iron Head" Heyward played 11 seasons in the NFL as a running back for several teams. He died from cancer in 2006. 
Cam Heyward says he was simply trying to pay tribute to his father and others affected by cancer. He writes that he had a "respectful" exchanged with the league and doesn't want to be a distraction to his team. Pittsburgh Steelers defensive end Cameron Heyward (97) has his father's nickname on his eyeblack during an NFL football game against the Arizona Cardinals, Sunday, Oct. 18, 2015, in Pittsburgh. (Don Wright/ AP) 
Heyward will wear plain eye black going forward and has started an initiative with EyeBlack.com to help provide money for cancer research. Advertisement
